padding: 14px 11px 10px 8px; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat;" data-cellinner="cell2"><div id="idEditableArea_1480696629541_cell2" data-innereditablearea="cell2"><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">TEACHING IN PSYCHOLOGY AND LAW: BRINGING THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM TO LIFE INSIDE THE CLASSROOM</font></strong><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Content Contributor: <font style="font-size: 16px;">Sara Appleby, Ph.D.</font></font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">When a last minute cancellation put her prison-based course back in the traditional classroom, Dr. Appleby had to quickly find ways to bring the complex dynamics and real voices of the criminal justice system to life for her students.&nbsp; This month, she shares diverse resources and methods for use inside the classroom.</font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">To read this column, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_07%20July%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/TeachPsy_Law.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">CALL FOR PAPERS: BEHAVIORAL SCIENCES AND THE LAW – SPECIAL ISSUE ON POLICING</font></strong><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Behavioral Sciences &amp; the Law announces a forthcoming special issue on Policing, to be edited by Christopher Slobogin, J.D., LL.M., a senior editor for the journal. Manuscripts that address the following issues are especially welcome: (1) research on the “benefits” and “costs” of various policing techniques, measured in procedural justice or other metrics; (2) research on how police should handle people with mental illness; (3) research on the psychological effects of surveillance by the police; (4) research on the psychological impact of policing on police officers.</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">For more information, please click <a 2020</font></strong></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">The AP-LS Annual Conference is&nbsp;</font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">March 5-7, 2020 at&nbsp;The Sheraton New Orleans Hotel&nbsp;500 Canal Street&nbsp;New Orleans, LA. Please visit:&nbsp;</font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/APLS2020">http://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/APLS2020</a>&nbsp;for the latest information regarding the conference. In addition, if you have any thoughts or ideas regarding plenary speakers, please feel free to e-mail&nbsp;</font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">any of us. We are starting our pursuit of plenary speakers and would love any ideas or assistance members may be able to provide.</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Kento Yasuhara (<a href="mailto:APLS2020Yasuhara@gmail.com">APLS2020Yasuhara@gmail.com</a>), Apryl Alexander (<a href="mailto:APLS2020Alexander@gmail.com">APLS2020Alexander@gmail.com</a>), and Angelica Hagsand (<a href="mailto:APLS2020Hagsand@gmail.com">APLS2020Hagsand@gmail.com</a>).&nbsp;</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">SPECIAL JOURNAL ISSUE ON JUVENILE JUSTICE RESEARCH</font></strong></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Described by:&nbsp; Thomas Grisso, Erika Fountain, Amanda NeMoyer &amp; Laura Thornton</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">The June 2019 e issue of the APA journal Translational Issues in Psychological Science is a special issue&nbsp; titled “Psychological Science and Juvenile Justice.”&nbsp; Its&nbsp; editorial classifies the various phases or steps in the research process of translating basic behavioral science to create, implement and evaluate methods for use in juvenile justice. The eight peer-reviewed&nbsp; articles in the special issue demonstrate various levels of translational research. To read this column, click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_07%20July%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/JuvenileJustice.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font color="#000000" style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">CAREER CORNER</font></strong><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font color="#000000" style="font-size: 16px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">The&nbsp;Career&nbsp;Corner&nbsp;is intended to highlight the individuals who work at the intersection of law and psychology, where they come from, how they got there and how their experiences influence their research, teaching, and/or practice. This edition of&nbsp;Career&nbsp;Corner profiles <em>Virginia Barber-Rioja, Ph.D., the Clinical Director of Mental Health at Correctional Health Services/NYC Health + Hospitals</em> and <em>Clinical Professor of Psychiatry at New York University School of Medicine.</em></font><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font color="#000000" face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">To read this column, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_07%20July%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/CareerCorner7_19.pdf">here</a>.</font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;"><br></font></p><font style="font-size: 16px;"><br></font><div>  <div style="line-height: 18px;">    <div style="line-height: 18px;"></div>  </div></div></div></td>													</tr>												</tbody></table>											</td>										</tr>									</tbody></table>								</td><td width="200" align="" class="cellContainer cell4Container" valign="top">									<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">										<tbody><tr>											<td class="cellOuter" valign="top" style="padding: 0px;" data-cellouter="cell4">												<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" data-cellborder="1">													<tbody><tr>														<td class="cellInner" valign="top" style="background-position: 0% 0%; padding: 14px 8px 0px; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat;" data-cellinner="cell4"><div id="idEditableArea_1480696629541_cell4" data-innereditablearea="cell4"><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">AP-LS VOICES HEARD IN APA</font></strong></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">Congratulations to Dr. Erika Fountain on her selection as a member of the new APA Advisory Group for Applied Psychology. The advisory group, which will be led by APA's Office of Applied Psychology,&nbsp;will have two main charges: 1) to make recommendations about how applied psychology can be better represented in APA; and 2) serve as a source of input and feedback regarding applied psychology issues and priorities. We are excited to see AP-LS part of this important advisory group.</font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">Jason Cantone was selected for the new APA Work Group on Accommodating Young Families. The work group is tasked with examining how APA could better support young families attending governance meetings and the annual convention (e.g., child care grants, on-site child care, nursing resources, family-friendly resources). During the first meeting, AP-LS was commended for its child care grants to assist families attending the annual AP-LS conference.&nbsp;</font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">If you're interested in serving on an APA group, APA is currently looking for new members for its Continuing Education Committee (applications due August 12), Committee on Early Career Psychologists (due August 28), Committee on Disability Issues in Psychology (due August 30), and APA Fellows Committee (due September 10). Contact APA Council Representative Jason Cantone (<a href="mailto:jasoncantone@gmail.com">jasoncantone@gmail.com</a>) for application materials.&nbsp;</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font
